provenance:
Albert Besnard, Paris, France; by descent to his son, Philippe Beasnard, Paris, France. Mr. E. S. Makower [1876-1946], London, England [1]; by descent to his wife, Mrs. Makower, London, England; (Makower sale, through Sotheby's, London, England, July 12, 1961, lot 81);[2] (jointly purchased by Julius H. Weitzner, London, England and M. Knoedler and Co., Inc., New York, New York);[3] purchased by the MIA in 1962.

[1] Mr. Makower was director of the Royal Academy of Music in London, and a Trustee of the London Museum.

[2] The work was sold under the title, "The Birthday Cake".

[3] Knoedler assigned the painting a stock number of [A8144]. The invoice to the MIA is dated January 7, 1963 (see curatorial file).
text: This vivaciously painted domestic subject belongs with a group of similar interior scenes with portraits of friends executed by Sargent in the 1880s. It depicts the family of the well-known French artists Albert Besnard (1849-1934) and his wife Charlotte Dubray (1855-1931), whom Sargent had befriended by 1883.
title: The Birthday Party
